>>52632804
No fucking duh fans ruin characters. The worst example that I've ever seen of mischaracterisation never even happened in fanfiction and fanart or by fans but by the original author himself in a book scifi series called the Hyperion Cantos that won the Hugos in 1889. The first two books are basically horror and hard scifi. The third book introduces a loli jesus who can save everyone, the guy who is in love with her and the terrifying monster famous for impaling people for all of eternity on a metaphysical tree decides to act as a taxi for them because of reasons.

The more times a character gets written the greater the chance they start diverging from the author's original vision because not only do you have to tell an interesting plot in which the character develops but you also can't diverge too far from the original character. And fans have a different interpretation of the same character often in a different context so there's going to be an even greater dissonance here especially if the author or setting won't let you see the character in their original context. Or they just rehash the same stuff you see in canon over and over again which can get boring for reasons.

Actually writing a character that has a villain morality and who is actually likeable is very difficult. Most published authors just cheat by making them hurt people off screen or making them only hurt people who deserve it.

As for the actual villains, well there is a reason why villains get offed the instant they do something redemption worthy. Writing what happens afterwards while having a character stay true to themselves is difficult.

Additionally, people like to write what they know so what they don't know will come out weird. Plus, they and the audience prefer likeable characters.

posts.name: Izix

>>52630380
The post ID that I tagged you in will be your code to trade on. EG if you are second trade code is 52630167. The order is to give you some idea of who is in front of you and how big their request is so you know roughly how long it might take for me to get to you so if your fifth you dont search for 15 minutes while im trading other people. If I search your code and don't find you I will tag you again telling you that I couldn't find you.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52630366
Not a stupid question don't worry, the encounter is the only way to get chi-yu at the moment which means altering fixed parameters (like the shininess) would make it illegal, which I'm pretty sure would instantly flag it in the game and make it untradeable at best, get your friend (and injector) in trouble at worst. It sucks because the shiny is amazing but we have to wait until there's a way to legally obtain it (eg. An event), unfortunately.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52630366
Shiny locked means any legend will be illegal if you make it shiny before its official release and since legends cant breed, you cant fool the game like with starters and eggs. I think GF is really cracking down on the shiny locked legends since people were creating shiny Zama/Zacian and Eternatus on day 1. I have a shiny Eternatus that was given to me a whole year before they finally unlocked his shiny but I couldnt go online with it cause I would be banned

Yeah.
Injected mons aren't different enough from regular Pokemon to be detected without such extensive scrutiny it's not worth the effort on TPCi's part.

I've battled someone in casual with a shiny snow ferret, so they don't seem to check for shiny locks.

Rather important if you want anything more than the multi-age agrarian drudgery due to manpower dependency, and the entire point of the village is that it ISN'T isolated, being the base camp for exploring the region that has contacts in Galar and Alola.

It was radium, and the quantities in use were really only a risk to the factory-workers who'd gotten their scandals all wrapped up before WW2. I'm talking 1950s-1980s here, the period where damned near every hard measurable factor of quality of living shot up to records at least CLOSE to all-time highs. Again, the boomers fucked it up catastrophically, because they had no clue how good they actually had it.

The entire student debt clusterfuck spawned from the very obtuse technicality of "lifetime earnings" that lag DECADES by definition. Leaded gasoline retarded gen X in such a fashion as to create all-time highs of violent crime. High fructose corn syrup is metabolically only marginally different from granular sugar, but proved so much cheaper due to legacy subsidies as to spawn quite the public health crisis.

It's that time of the year again, welcome to the /vp/ Monotype Tournament!

Put together a gym leader style team and battle it out in the Monotype tournament where you fight to win a gym leader spot and represent your favorite type in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet!

Rules and details: https://pastebin.com/VEH2MVZ0

Tournament starts on the 27th of December.

Need to practice, team-build, or get some breeding leftovers to help you prepare for the tournament? Post away! There's plenty of people around to help!

All communications will be conducted within discord once the tournament begins.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: I for one did not care for the arrangements in heart gold and soul silver. The original chiptune sound font is INFINITELY better than the muted mess we get on the DS. I really hope there's someone out there that feels the same and has tried to accurately replicate 1-to-1 the feel of the original soundtrack. Case in point: the epic electric guitar from the gym theme turns into GOD DAMN TRUMPETS! (and yet people give gen 3 a bad rap ffs). Probably the only decent remade track was national park, but even then it STILL pales in comparison to the original. As someone who collects the soundtrack CDs, it's a fucking TRAGEDY that the original gen 2 soundtrack was the only one that was never released physically and I will never not be mad.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: I was born in 1993. I remember being too young to remember but watching Pokemon cartoons in the morning before school. I remember being slightly older than seeing people with Gameboy colors and wishing I could play any of those games. I remember Sapphire being my first game I ever owned and being an obsessive fan from that point on. Every game that came out I wanted to play it and beat it. I completely adored Mystery dungeon. Towards the end of high school I got into competitive and that completely sparked an entire new light to my love of the series. I took a break from competitive in my early twenties but as a person in my late 20s I'm more interested to get into competitive than ever, I even signed up for the Pokemon professor judge program. You could say I'm basically Pokemon's perfect golden example of a fanboy that will likely never stop buying games

>>52625697
This was literally the best sidequest in the series. It gave you a reason to explore and most of them were in awkward areas so it gave you a reason to go off the beaten track (aside from a handful which the player might come across normally, which ensures the player is at least aware of them and knows to look out for them). And as a reward, you get 4 legendaries. Even if you dislike searching for things across the map, it's objectively better than pretty much every other item hunt that has appeared in past games (Spiritomb wisps, Alolan Digletts, Zygarde cells, mega stones) since their are far fewer things to find, they're far easier to spot and there are no time-based restrictions that would cause you to miss them even if you were in the right area.

Only other sidequest that comes close is the regi one, but even that was just a case of interpreting the braille with your user guide since it literally tells you the answer to all the "riddles" once you translate it.

Gallery of art drawn for stories in the thread: https://imgur.com/a/sjdck

>Can I post NSFW fics?
There are no rules against NSFW text links.

>How should I post my fics?
If it's short enough to fit into a couple of posts, posting to the thread is fine. If you want to share longer works, or if you want more permanent storage, you can link to a host: fanfiction.net, AO3, Pastebin, or Google Docs.

>I'm not a writer but I want to contribute
>Can I request something?
You're encouraged to post prompts, i.e. short snippets or greentext sequences describing your ideas. You can also expand on prompts posted by others. If writing an entire story from start to finish feels too daunting, this is a way to get started.

>I have this idea about [event/technology/...]
Feel free to post your thoughts about how specific parts of the Pokémon world function as well. Worldbuilding is always welcome.

>Can I add a fic I wrote to the catalog?
Check the catalog for the submission link. Fill out the form with all the necessary information and it will be submitted for review automatically.

We're also looking to collect ideas for fanfics as a resource for stumped writers. Feel free to throw an idea out there; someone may choose to use it themselves!

>>52601513
There are fightscene breakdowns on youtube, watch them.

There’s a wealth of MMA analysis and guides, of weapons fighting tips, of tactics in war.

There’s pokemon showdown and a ton of guides on competitive battling, the meat of those are about outsmarting your opponent. You can incorporate literally any of this material, though dont get too bogged down by game mechanic or tier list bullshit.

You probably have seen, maybe read, some good fightscenes through your life. Watch them again with an analytical mind and figure out how to translate what works into your format.

And for the love of god, if you’re doing this to write well dont try to become an expert on all this infinite amount of material. Have a loose idea on what sort of feeling you want for the fight or the concept of it, and then direct your research based on that specifically to start building that one fightscene. Make loose notes and a basic timeframe as you go, otherwise you’ll get lost in the sauce and just have unwritten ideas or be researching forever.

I'll read it if you write it. I wrote a short bloombolt story myself a while back, long before the fad. It wasn't very good, and was kinda just something I had the urge to do and get out of my system at the time. It was short, unoriginal, and vanilla. Anyway, here's a scenario off the top of my head for you:
>If you're following the current gold-digger meme, then you have her start out by wedging herself into his life post-champ, posing as wanting to "watch out for him, in case some old friends of his try to take advantage of his newfound fame and status" when, of course, she's doing so just to isolate him for herself to do just that, which he obliviously accepts; however, over time of "borrowing" money and basking in the benefits of being a famous person's gf and basically being royalty in Alola because of it, his relentless positivity makes her actually fall for him, first by making her more protective of his dumbass self, to the point where she starts to feel guilty for taking advantage of his trust and friendship before, and later taken in by his uncanny ability to unintentionally be really, really smooth with words, saying things that, to him, aren't romantic phrases, but to the listener, are (consider looking at the High Touch! doujin in Dawn General for examples of this).

That said, here's an angle you can take, because, funny enough, the two actually have an amusing dynamic to them for a ship that fits their characters, if you can capture it: One is a total Pokénut who is endlessly open and willing to try new things whereas the other is more reserved, only has a surface level interest in Pokémon, and is often unnerved by the other's extreme extroversion; the fact that both get along despite being polar opposites in personality and mood makes for great potential dynamics that grounds the both of them into a balance. And in that "balance," you have your ship.

Back again. Here is what I came up with.
It was the morning of his 16th birthday. Kai was hopeful that his parents would finally let him have a Pokémon and go off on his own to challenge gyms. Ever since he was 10 he loved watching trainers battle on TV, and in his spare time he would head out into the forest to observe the Pokémon.

“Good morning” He said to his parents, who were preoccupied with making breakfast. Still groggy from just rolling out of bed, and a little annoyed he was woken by the banging of pots and pans. He didn’t let it show, he was thankful for his parents for going out of the way to make a meal.

His parents were never thrilled with the idea of their son being a trainer. They had thought it would be a passing phase he would eventually grow out of. It’s been 6 years since he said “I want to be a trainer!”

Mom and Dad were in the kitchen getting breakfast ready. An unusual sight for this household, they were usually too busy to make a proper meal in the morning.

“Good morning, Happy birthday” Dad replied.

“Morning” Said mom, who was too preoccupied with something on the stove to give a full response.

“Why don’t you get yourself fully dressed and ready so we can start celebrating” Dad said. “By the time you’re back down breakfast will be ready and we can all sit down together.” Said dad.

The kitchen was alive with the sounds of a full meal in the works, food sizzling, kitchenware clanging and banging.

“Finally, a proper breakfast” Kai thought. He loved his Mother’s cooking, she’s a very talented cook, but she doesn’t flex her skills very often, or at least not as often as Kai would like.

“Maya should be here soon with your first gift, so make sure you’re presentable.” Added Mom. “We went through hell and high water to get it.” Said mom, turning away from the stove and acknowledging him fully for the first time.

“Sure thing Mom”

1/2.

They didn’t see the glamor in being a trainer, and wanted their son to focus his energy on trying to get a regular job the same way they did.

“Finally, a proper breakfast” Kai thought. He loved his Mother’s cooking, she’s a very talented cook, but she doesn’t flex her skills very often, or at least not as often as Kai would like.

“Sure thing Mom”

He eagerly raced up the stairs to get himself ready. He knew that his parents had capitulated in their struggle to get him to give up on being a trainer. He knew because Maya was involved. Maya was his next door neighbor, she moved here from Unova 8 years ago with her Father. She was outgoing, and ambitious, but sometimes overbearing. Most importantly, Maya was a very talented trainer, and already had her first badge from Oreburgh City. That’s how Kai new his parents had changed their mind - if Maya was involved Pokémon were involved.

Kai and Maya were friends of circumstance, despite Kai being put off buy her general disagreeableness, their close proximity to one another essentially forced them to get along. It wasn’t all bad though, Maya would often take him along to watch her battle, other trainers or just wild Pokémon, which he absolutely loved doing. Kai hurriedly got ready, he knew breakfast was almost ready and he didn’t want to keep his parents waiting since they made an extra effort to make him breakfast. He headed back downstairs as his parents were setting three places at the table.

“Thanks for doing this guys, It means a lot to me” Kai said.

“No problem sweetie” replied mom

“Is there anything you need me to do?”

“Nope! Just sit tight, everything is almost ready.”

The peace was suddenly interrupted by the door slamming open

“Where’s the birthday boy, he’s gonna LOVE the gift I got him!”

Maya’s here.

The loud entry snapped Mom out of her focus. She was annoyed even more by Maya saying she alone got the gift. While it was technically true, Mom and Dad had made an agreement with Maya that she would say it was a gift from everyone. She was also here 40 minutes early.

“Welcome Maya! So good to see you! Kai, go help with her coat and I’ll run and set another place at the table for her.” Mom was very good at hiding whenever she was annoyed or upset.

Kai got up and helped her as instructed.

“Hey, thanks for coming” He said as he was helping with her jacket. He didn’t want to be so forward as to ask about the gift, but it was all that was on his mind.

“Yeah I wouldn’t miss this day for the world, let me keep my jacket” She said, brushing him off “I wanna show you your gift quickly, but act like it’s a surprise when I show you later in front of them”

The two of them stepped outside quickly. The chilly fall air was nipping at their cheeks. Maya reached into her bag and pulled out a pokeball.

“No way, are you serious?” Asked Kai.

“Yes!” Maya released the Pokémon, and a starly emerged, and began nervously flying around. “Happy birthday! He’s all yours, just be careful, he’s still not used to being in a pokeball so be extra gentle with him. >>52633484
Check'd. First time we actually see a broken limb is with Rock Tomb, and it does shock Lee at the time. I don't mind Pokemon being a bit gorier with these sorts of fights, but I do have two objections.
>Lee gets over the savagery of these fights in no time
Much ado was made about whether he could stand to see his Vulpix get hurt, but after a few weeks of intense battling it hardly affects him at all. This process should have been much more gradual. Kids in that world can stand it because they grow up watching it like with Romans and gladiatorial games, but Lee is not only a modern American, but a zookeeper. Pitting pseudo-animals in vicious fights should make him uncomfortable to his core.
>The idea of pokemon dying in a fight is so foreign that war footage gets scrubbed off the internet
Despite pokemon pulling out the stops and using fangs, claws, poison, rocks, fire, and everything else in fights, it's implied there are NEVER any accidental casualties. I don't want the fic to be "ooh so grimdark and edgy, everyone can die!" but if you start out the story with people violently dying, then there should be at least a risk of something like that happening to a beloved pokemon. For comparison, professional boxers are limited to punching with padded gloves, with plenty of set rules, and casualties still happen sometimes. Even if pokemon are "stupid durable" that should be a sad risk of the sport.

Haven't finished my re-read on the QQ thread, but cross-posting is pretty normal in this particular community. SpaceBattles is the most popular, QuestionableQuesting was created independently but happened to coincide with SB having a wave of porn ban enforcement so it picked up a solid user base, and Sufficient Velocity was made when SB's server hardware was physically breaking down AND a blowup over a staff member being fired underhandedly so for several years people cross-posted just in case SB suffered total data loss.

Then there's the cluster of weird-ass spinoffs like the one made by the stalker who impersonated an SB mod on QQ, the one made by the OTHER stalker who's an ultra-far-left lunatic, the Luxury Gay Space Communist's "Free Speech Zone" that has closed because the owner doxxed himself on KiwiFarms (where he still posts...), and TheSietch founded by some ex-staff over conservative witch-hunting.

Plus the old basically-dead rival StarDestroyer.net, the significant but not STRONG overlap with AlternateHistory.com that's run by literally three people with some incredibly strange forum culture as a result of the catastrophic understaffing, and the consequences of being the spawning grounds of several weird fandoms.

When people talk retarded Versus bullshit, it probably goes back to SB. When people talk Familiar of Zero fanfiction, it probably goes back to SB. When people talk about WildBow's Worm, it probably goes back to SB. When people talk Planetary Annihilation Self-Inserts, it probably goes back to SB. The site is older than 4chan, seeing some absolutely absurd political shifts in lurching to the modern norms.

posts.com:
>>52634766
>umbreon has a psa10 pop of over 2000 cards
>zard is up huge from pre-2019 prices
>umbreon started high and only went higher

Zard is following a simple trend of demand driving a hype bubble followed by a price retraction to a new price floor significantly above where it was before. It's price is driven by true demand and scarcity.

Umbreon is following a classic hype bubble trend. It has no scarcity and its price is only fueled by people feeling that they will be missing out on it as it rises further, creating a self fulfilling prophecy. While demand is a greater driver off price than supply, neither is the driver of umbreon's price. Umbreon's price is purely driven by hype and is completely artificial. As such it is unsustainable and will collapse eventually. It's not a matter of "if" but "when"
It may not go down tomorrow, or next week or next month, but it will. Once people realize how many are out there it will go down. Once people realize that there's no reason to pay $550 for a card with >2000 psa10s, it will go down. But that can take a while.

Lastly, evolving skies is the ONLY outlier among modern. Using umbreon as an example is not really proving anything. There will always be exceptions.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Got a shiny dusk lycanroc in 2 tries, spent more time finding the right time to set the switch to than hunting, got a random midnight lycanroc just doing the 60kills before it.
if anyone else wants to do it
>get lycanroc outbreak (reset outbreaks in top right map, kill 60 and save
>turn off game, change your system clock in increments (a day is like 36 mins apparently, 72 for day/night) and reload the game until you find the transition from day>night, change the time a few mins at a time until you find dusk lycanroc's spawn time (picnic to reset spawns when you load in), set it about 2mins before their spawn time (enough time to load the game and make a sandwhich) and remember that time cause you gotta reset back to it after every try, you have ~3min window to try for it before it switches to midnight form

The difference is that JP viewers are more appreciative of the series as a charming, inoffensive weekly commodity. Even if the animation isn't as beautiful as the previous two series, the effort and circumstances are respected more. They watch it every week, and enjoy it on the same level as we might enjoy a Sunday program after football.

But the western fan base is far more invested, to an unhealthy degree. It's an identity, an obsession, and they treat the show like something they're paying for and owed, and holding it to the same standard as a program meant for adults.

I catch it every week but I don't seethe like you faggots because it's always more or less the same-- fun, aesthetically pleasing misadventures with Pokémon, which I love.

>*Research Analysis: BC-001
>From: Professor Nils Odurt

Through my analysis and documentation, I have stumbled upon a horrific mutation that seems to come from Shroomish living too long in bogs and swamps. It seems to have begun swelling in mass, but instead of becoming a Breloom, it just melts into itself. It's claws are enormous, but it has lost most of its original speed and physical strength. We've come to call it Breconsume for now.

It's a very tenacious and terrifying predator, preferring to camouflage itself in the dead surrounding plant matter of its environment. Prey that comes within its reach is often hooked by its massive claws and swallowed whole. The few that can escape are often drenched in toxic spores and poisonous fluids that quickly deprive them of stamina and strength. It is a patient hunter, one that stalks its prey before enveloping it whole. I've taken some samples of its feedings and residue left behind. I had to capture one that was stalking me, I have no clue if they can be properly tamed, but I feel a little excited to have one in my possession. I'll provide further documentation on the subject later and how it handles captivity compared to wild ones.

>>52606356
Nils is a Norwegian boys name that means "People of victory" and at the time when we were plotting on making a region that is antagonistic and polar opposite of Zirca, I thought it was a very appropriate name that someone would probably name their kid with. I even thought that his dad could have been a veteran from either that war or one prior to it.

Odurt is based on the Norwegian word for "Water Hemlock" since I wanted him to be themed around poisonous things that are used in medicine. I thought about either that, Macula, or just Hemlock. The latter one seemed too on the nose. Macula almost became his middle name, but I stuck with Nils Odurt since it was simple and easy to remember.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52606311
(For shits and grins)
>Research Analysis: ST-001
>From: Nils Odurt

Normally, the Alolan Morelull and Shiinotic are a Grass/Fairy type Pokemon. Known for their vibrant luminescence and their ability to produce spores and lights that induce sleep on travelers. In the region of Valkha, I've noticed a peculiarity that has formed in this region's variant of them. Nocturnal in nature, they live primarily in thick and dense forests, hiding until sunset where they come out.

These type of Shiinotic are much more dimly luminescent than their Alolan relatives, difficult to make out with the naked eye, but it seems to be an evolutionary adaptation to their environment. Despite this, they still glow under ultraviolet light, more florescent than bio-luminescence. They have a distinct red coloration to their caps, resembling witches hats and their bodies are a light brown. They seem to react to hostile threats by radiating a sort of aura that seems to affect the minds of their enemies. It drains them of their energy, they become lethargic and depressed the longer they stay within the area of influence of these Shiinotic. Almost like it's sapping away all the positive energy they have, and the Shiinotic become much more active after such encounters. They even gather and dance with each other in clearings, a strange dance that I can't seem to describe with words alone.

I must admit that being here leaves me feeling rather hesitant and fearful. I've heard from locals in a neighboring town about these woods being home to dark spirits and curses because of their history. I can't confirm that these are anything more than superstitious rumors, but the presence of ghost Pokemon and other creatures that seem to frequent such locations are prevalent here as well. I've taken to capturing a Valkhan Morelull and Shiinotic for further research.

I would like to post myself here in Valkha for now as this place utterly fascinates me to no end.

>>52611840

>Research Analysis: LL-001
>From: Nils Odurt

The further north that I go, the more things seem to change in terms of adaptation. I wouldn't have expected to see Shroomish up here, but they've seemed to develop a sort of adaptation even in the freezing temperatures high up in Valkha.

You would think Pokemon like Shroomish would be ill-fit to endure the snow and frost. The adaptation seems to stem from them eating a certain type of lichen that thrives up here. It is in their regular consumption of this fauna that they begin to undergo an evolutionary change. They develop thick lichenous growths, it covers their mantle and most of their body like a hair of sorts. Arms are much stronger than their Breloom counterparts, A single claw on each arm, thick and short with a hooked end.

They seem to be much more prone to initiating combat against a threat than their tropical brethren. Lost a lot of their capacity to use spores in combat, instead they relentlessly barrage their opponents with terrible slashes and piercing strikes with their fists. It is amazing just how fast they seem to move, a strange elegance it's almost like they dance around their opponent. Not a lot of stamina in them though, it might be because of the fact that they burn through energy faster than they can produce it. If they can't defeat their opponent quickly, they seem to use their tails as a scoop to gather up a large amount of snow to blind their opponent before fleeing.

Due to the vast change in appearance and temperament between them and Breloom, it would be wise to assume they are a distinct divergent evolution. I've taken to calling them "Lavloom", but the name is more for my own personal recording purposes and fully open to change if need be. I managed to catch one in battle, a miracle if anything else. It along with the samples I've gathered will be sent to you for further analysis.

>>52615949
>Research Analysis: V-SS-001
>From: Nils Odurt

Near the western shores of Valkha, I've discovered a series of wetlands and marshes that dot throughout the area. It is in one of these areas that I've discovered a strange variant of Kantoian Sandshrew/Sandslash. Their hide takes on the qualities of their environment, coated and tinted from the algae and bog debris. This seems to be a defensive adaptation that lets them avoid predation in return. Due to limited options, they seem to have evolved piscivorious traits along with the insectivore traits of their Kantoian relatives. Sharp harpoon-like tail, specialized hands that end with three fingers that end with long claws with grooves that easily pierce into the slippery hide of their aquatic. Webbing between their fingers gives them great locomotion in the water, and also lets them dig easily into the marshland mud.

The back of the Valkhan Sandslash has rather impressive sharpened scales; thick, but they have extraordinary flexibility to move around their territory. From what I've seen, they are normally adverse to interacting with others, they are much more inclined to hiding if the option to run is provided. Otherwise, they will react aggressively, their serrated claws can shred flesh and the tip of their tail seems perfectly suited for piercing thick hides and scales. From what I've seen, when they are pressured into combat, they will not stop until their aggressor is rendered incapacitated or dead.

That said, I have acquired samples along with a Valkhan Sandslash. They will be sent to you for further examination. Fighting one was difficult enough, especially with the difficult terrain. You try to engage in battle with one in mud that goes up to your hips.

((I had to shift the idea of how their hands and feet looked because for the sake of locomotion in water, they really should have webbed hands and feet. I figured with webbed hands that end in serrated claws would be perfect.))

>TL;DR Fuck wasting time resetting because I caught an adamant Lugia. Let me dump money to make it perfect for whatever I want. And fuck alternative currencies like BP.

Gen 5 started the decline of the series from it’s focus on story rather than adding new gameplay elements that matter like weather, abilities, held items, physical/special split, etc. There are still some occasional good pokes since Gen 4 but most are just inoffensive slop with some occasional really bad ones.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
1. Competitive pokemon became so detached from casual level with its hacking and shit, it should be put onto some officialy sanctioned showdown-esque battle simulator with full customization of the mons. Mainline games could then get some more experimental changes with battle system like PLA with strong/agile style or more interesting story. I think these concept changes are held back by the fact that regular game has to be "same" with competitive one, but these worlds should be separated completely.

2. Dexit wasn't bad in itself, but in the context of Gen 8 copying all models and animations from 3DS, while at the same time Masuda and his doggies said shit about making all remaining mons "more expressive" which turned out to be lies. So it turned out just to be cutting dex for no reason other than reselling returning mons in the dlcs.
It would be much more understandable in the context of current gen, how it actually updates many models like Charizard or Persian and gives some animations like pokemon swimming etc. Don't get me wrong, it's still a cashgrab to hold favorite mons hostage in Home, but I honestly don't care about national dex, lmao.

3. Fans should stop begging for remakes to happen, like they did with Sinnoh remakes. I'd rather not have any remake of older game ever, than get another BDSP, uninspiring, useless, faithfully bad remakes. It's embarassing that they were so faithful that even fucking poketch has no return button and you can scroll only forward, it's minor thing, but it shows how utterly stupid it was for them to be as "faithful" to the originals as possible. And then those retards like Merrick saying "but these are DP remakes, not Platinum". No more remakes at all!

4. Greninja is horribly disgusting with the fact that it's "scarf" is actually his tongue. It's also way overhyped with all those broken things he got, Protean, Ash-Greninja. Too much pandering for a worst Water starter.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
nature and evs are shitty mechanics.
nature is the most egregious to me, because it takes something that sounds kino (differentiating pokemon through personality) and turns it into a numbers only thing. a brave pokemon behaves exactly the same as a timid one barring the stat changes, and that's bullshit.
evs suck because the non-autistic player has no in-game method of figuring out different pokemon ev methods, resulting in an insignificant difference in gameplay experience as players are unable to train certain stats effectively with the tools they are given. evs are pointless to even autistic compfags, as they just edit evs to their liking. ev grinding is not fun, and doesn't add anything interesting to the game.
i'm personally on the fence about ivs. having differentiation between pokemon makes sense, but the way it's implemented doesn't feel right for some reason. Perhaps it's because pokemon battles are so binary. Either you're faster or not, there's little room for variation.

>>52619226
Gen 5 is overrated. It's not bad, quite the opposite, but it gets tiresome to see so many people (not here on /vp/, but on the other parts of the Internet) hail it as the second coming of Christ. N is just beta Lillie. Also, graphics-wise, gen 4 is better than gen 5.
Gardevoir is not a good waifumon. This is coming from someone that sexualizes basically any Pokémon. One of my favorite waifus is Breloom
I have an irrational hate for Lucario, but when Armarouge and Ceruledge were revealed, they dethroned Lucario as my least favourite Pokémon. They don't really look like Pokémon. Gen 9 has some really solid designs but these two are not one of them. I'm not even being contrarian, I legitimately hate them.
XY are underrated. That is not to say they're good, they're just mediocre, but essentially they're just gen 3 and 4 but on the 3DS (gen 5 actually has more in common with gen 7 and after). The problem is that they're undercooked and extremely easy, even for a Pokémon game. I also picked Chespin when I first played the game back in 2013, and I stand by my decision. Chesnaught is severely underrated.
SV were good and I'm legitimately surprised that the popular opinion has been worse for them than it was for SwSh. Sure, they're full of bugs (even though the only one I've faced is the lightning being weird, which admittedly does happen a lot) and the god-awful optimisation; but even with these problems they're much better than SwSh.
Even though I've shat on SwSh just now I don't even think they're bad (I still didn't buy them, a friend lent me his copy of Sword so I could play it). They're bad for a Pokémon game, yes, but on the grand scale of things, they're just extremely mediocre. Then again Pokémon has rotted my brain so much that I'm unable to not have fun with it. I'm a part of the problem, I know
I think that's all. Feel free to shit on my opinions.

>>52631914
tsareena- atk down through shield with trop kick, sweet veil for sleep raids so people dont need to taunt/safety goggles/terrain. max hp spdef careful. dual screens, hh/taunt (or drop a screen and make 2 per dmg type).

espathra- ohko/solomon for fighting and poison raids, speed boost, CM, lumina crash STAB -2 SpDef down through shield, stored power drops things like flies with cm and speed boost ramp, flex (reflect, roost)

umb- screens, swap, and HH(duh). offers taunt, tears, tickle, snarl, screech which chansbliss lacks

grimsnarl- prankster screens, taunt, fake tears, confide, misty terrain (dragon raids/anti status)
i have 2 made with 1 screen + chilling water/spirit break lowering atk/spatk through shield

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
The shitty movepool seems to be more a result of Poison/Steel being kind of a shitty offensive type combination to begin with. People kept asking for a Poison/Steel type but aside from mogging fairies extra well the two types do not complement each other that well. On paper Revavroom's moveset is something lots of Pokemon would love to have:

>Good attack and mid tier speed which can be boosted by Shift Gear
>A 100 BP 100 accuracy STAB with a relatively negligible drawback
>120 BP 80 accuracy STAB for high risk play
>Reliable 80 BP moves if you want consistency

The biggest issue is the shit coverage options it has. Basically have to run Tera Blast on it.

>why are you comparing a midgame mon to a bunch of legends and paras
A)The classification literally does not matter
B)We have early game Pokemon like Staraptor and Talonflame that are really strong; more potent than a "mid game" Pokemon like Revavroom.
C)In game LITERALLY does not matter anymore because Game Freak won't even let us turn off EXP Share or turn on Switch Mode. Literally anything is usable when your team of 6 is 10 - 15 levels above everything else long before you even finish the game. You would have a valid argument if this were Gens 1 - 5 where in game balance was an actual concern of Game Freak's or the players'.

>moreover of course Tera Blast is an argument, because it makes Revaroom much less shit.
No, it's not an argument. You can have already effective Pokemon that run Tera Blast to be even more effective, or you can have game breaking Pokemon like Espathra that are much more worthy of being used. You can only Tera once, and why would you Tera Revavroom when there are 30 - 40 better choices?

It's the same argument against Mewtwo in VGC. Sure, it can be good, but you're using up your restricted 'mon slot for a Pokemon that just isn't as effective as your other options.

>The obvious Shift Gear set needs it for coverage because otherwise Zen Headbutt/Bulldoze don't get there, but also it having Tera Blast makes it not walled by steels.
That's the point. It needs Tera Blast to even get anything done, whereas you have many better options to use your Terastallization on. If you Tera any other Pokemon, you can't Tera Revavroom, and if you can't Tera Revavroom it's worthless.

>it will do well in lower tiers, it's like a much better Klinklang
Klinklang is a ZU Pokemon. Literally bottom of the barrel. Even then, Klinklang is arguably better because of Clear Body, better signature move, and Electric coverage.

The AI professor is in possession of the professor's copy of the paradox book as well as all 7 of them when they enter the time machine. This would explain sightings made by the team only when deep inside of Area Zero.

This can easily be explained that when the AI enters the time machine at the end of the story, they are sent 200 years into the past and encounter Heath and follow what's written in the book to continue the loop. What it says in the title

>Water Veil
Now also buffs SpDef in Rain

Adds +1 to all Attack boosts as well as protecting from attack drops (Hone Claws now looking scary)

>Magma Armor
Becomes more like Water Bubble. Protects from freeze and now also reduces damage from ice and water moves. May also add an effect where it makes fire move stronger, but that doesn't really seem to fit the theming of this ability.

>Forecast
When this Pokémon switches in it will automatically activate this ability regardless of the weather IF it is carrying a weather rock or knows a weather causing move. If either condition is Matt, this ability will activate and then cause a particular weather to occur based on either this pokémon's held item (which weather rock it has) or which weather move is in its first move slot (or closest to the first move slot), with the weather rock taking precedence over the move slot. Also gives this Pokémon a passive 20% buff to speed and special attack as long as there is active weather

>>52628738
The Japanese name specifically is "super powerful claws" so it was always meant to refer to Pokémon that have claws, Mawile I guess not withstanding. You could give it a passive effect where if the Pokémon is hitting with a contact move, it could ignore the opponent's defensive boosts. So it would basically block attack drops but also work like Unaware in very specific cases -- namely you are hitting an opponent with a contact move. So that would mean that it wouldn't directly make you stronger but it gives you more potential to take down certain opponents. Now you can send in Crabominable or Kingler and know that your Liquidation or Drain Punch has insurance that it will always have the potential to do however much damage you expected to do regardless of what the opponent is doing defensively

Design philosophy may shift back and forth over the years in different directions but the key point always missed is that there is no qualitative metric by which you can say one is bad and the other is good. The underlying issue is that Pokémon has been a largely mediocre RPG since its inception capitalizing on an addictive formula rather than a well made experience. Kids who didn’t fall off and instead leaned into that addiction and tied their entire identity to it (e.g. /vp/ posters) are now stuck trying to find the reason why it doesn’t feel as good as they remember it. We all had Pokémon we liked and didn’t like growing up. Your tastes and preferences in design are inherently different from other people let alone when looking at 151 to now 1000+ designs. But it’s easier to say everything just got worse and cling to false memories.
tl;dr cope

This thread is for the growth of artists and those who draw for fun. If you're going to give critique, please do it constructively. Rude or blunt critiques won't help anybody.

Requesters are free to request what they wish, but avoid bumping your request every half hour as it's only going to put people off; try giving it a few hours or more.

Please provide references in ONE image, especially when requesting something outside of the Pokémon universe. If you request something from the old Drawthread or a separate thread, COPY & PASTE the actual request instead of posting a link.

Also, be mindful that requests are done at the discretion of the artists, not on a first come first serve basis.

Please remember to save any piece of art you like from these threads, as we may never know when the archive will start deleting images again. Artists can and are recommended to post their works on other outlets for archival purposes.

>The player is only allowed to catch the first Pokemon they encounter in the area. If the Pokemon faints or escapes, then you can no longer catch a Pokemon in that area.

Just reached Vermillion, enough for today. I'm really liking my team so far.
>Brock
Charmander Ember'd down Geodude and Growled at Onix until he was in crit range. Swapped to a Level 3 Rattata and Onix proceeded to Bide over an over as I got in 6 Tail Whips. Swapped to Beedrell and Fury Attack'd him down after a String Shot to make sure I outsped, it took forever.
>Misty
Ekans vs. Staryu went fine with the snake knowing Dig. Starmie comes out and I swap to Kadabra on a Critical Bubblebeam so lucky me, I have to swap so I go to Beedrill on an X-Defense. Two Twineedles do 80% to Starmie as it Water Guns me to just over half, I swap to Fearow on a Tackle. Fearow finished Starmie with a Peck.
Overall it's been pretty good, some nasty crits here an there but luckily no deaths.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I lied, I played some more... I lost Kadabra by trying to Confusion a Geodude so it can't blow up, turns out my Kadabra had shit Special since it didn't kill, but a critical Selfdestruct sure did.
Swapped him out for a Machop I caught in Rock Tunnel, then in Celadon I bought a Dratini and grinded it on Diglett until it evolved.
>Surge
Kadabra dealt with Voltorb and Pikachu. I swapped to Arbok on Raichu using an X-Attack, then a single dig killed it in one hit.
>Erika
Beedrill is THE counter to Erika, Twineedle does 4x damage to Victreebel and Vileplume killing in one one, well two, shots. Tangela took all of two hits to take out.
I hope I can Agility strat Sabrina with Beedrill, it's always such a nice moment.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Classes were cancelled so... Done!
>Koga
Was swept by Machamp with Earthquake, Weezing survived but decided to eat an X-attack.
>Sabrina
Twineedle on Kadabra, set up Agility on Mr.Mime as it set up a Light Screen, then Beedrill proceeds to sweep with Twineedle. Nice.
>Blaine
Another Earthquake sweep, Arcanine survived and Toke Down'd Machamp twice.
>Giovanni
Lead with Fearow thinking the lead was Dugtrio, had to swap into Dragonair on a Stomp, proceeded to sweep the whole lot with Ice Beam. Nido's survived but both used Tackle... Red and Blue gyms are dumb.

>Lorelei
Machamp is a champ, Rock Slide and Low Kick dealt with everyone but Lapras who got a nasty hit in with Hydro Pump.
Swapped to Fearow and got clapped with another Hydro Pump. Swap again to Arbok on a miss, Dig activates a Super Potion and then two Acid's take Lapras down as it hits a Confuse Ray and a Blizzard. Closer than I would've liked.

>Bruno
Arbok Mega Drains, Digs, and Acids through everyone save for Machamp. I swap for an honor battle and Strength Bruno's Machamp down.

>Agatha
Arbok Digs through Gengar. Golbat forces a switch to Fearow on a Wing Attack and Double-Edge takes down Golbat and Drill Peck deals with Haunter. I swap to Arbok on Arbok and Dig through it and the incoming Gengar.

>Lance
An absolute sweep with Dragonite, Boltbeam is unstoppable

>Rival
Fearow two shots Pidgeot as it struggles to do damage, Alakazam gets outsped and taken out with a Double-Edge.
On Rhydon I swap to Machamp and take it down with two Earthquakes as it Hits a nasty 5-hit Fury Attack and a Leer, Arcanine goes down to an Earthquake.
Swap to Beedrill on Exeggutor and get hit with Hypnosis, Beedrill and Arbok both get worn down by bad sleep luck, Charizard burns up the palmtree.
Blastoise comes out and I swap to Mahcmap ona withdraw and Deal some nice damage with EQ but I'm low, I swap Dragonite on a Hydro Pump... thank god... and Thunderbolt for the win.

Thunder from Gengar on Gyrados after two misses on both sides, a Hypnosis on Dragonair and then Blizzard sweep with Starmie.

>>52613793
Sparkling power doesn't affect eggs, the only way to further boost your odds with masuda method is to have a shiny charm. also level 3 egg power isn't really worth it, you're better off making great peanut butter sandwiches (1 banana, 1 peanut butter, 1 butter) for egg power 2.
The best place to hatch eggs is the zero gate, you can host picnics, no pokemon spawn there, and it's completely lagless. I like to save before i make the sandwich and wait for eggs so I can reset the game instead of manually releasing every pokemon, another helpful little tip is to use multi-select the eggs vertically to put them in your party since it's less tedious. it should take about 3 minutes for the basket to fill up with 10 eggs if you're using two cats. if you need a non-eng cat you can use one of the starter trade codes at midnight when there's less eng players, same goes for the ditto code. good luck anon.

>>52631285
The issue I have with fingers is that while I'm fine with purely visual 3 fingers, I can't just stay in realm if pure visuals. My thoughts often model a possible interaction with Mewoscarada, assuming pokemon would be real, how would she act and behave in mundane real life, given her anatomical specificities. And let me tell you, having just 3 fingers sucks massive ass. You cant grip things as good as 4-fingeres creatures and overall you will be very clunky and even basic tasks like picking up cups or dishes or even a hairbrush is gonna be moderately more challenging.
There are reasons and justifications I can go to allows some deviation from model design, and they almost always backed up by some basic logic and common sense, not my personal preference

How many kills do you typically get when you go carry? I keep saying but this is my thoughts on it.

>>52609014
It's like if you get too many kills and deal too much damage you'll often get placed in teams where you are the highest rated or have highest Win Rating. Matches where if you play your best Character and do well then you have a 50/50 chance of winning. but if you play something else like a support or something you don't normally play then you'll have no chance at winning. But if you are a player that typically doesn't get over 10 kills and never get 20 kills a game then you'll not often get paired with sub 45%ers because the game doesn't think you can carry them and won't place them with you as often. That's my current theory anyway.

The path is this one

>Emerald

>Green Leaf
Mainly because is the only one, in all of Gen 3, where you can have a Slowpoke.
>Coliseum/XD
Good to hold your mons, mainly because you need the full Hoenn Dex 3 times to have the Johto Starters. Also, best Lugia.
>Platinum
Is the full version, adding almost 60 POKEMON THAT WERE CUT IN DP.
>Heart Gold
Is a great remake, go play that instead.
>Rangers
Mainly because of Darkrai and Mareany or whatever the blue thing's name was
>White/Black 2
Mainly because of Iris and Yancy
>X or Y

Great for Hoenn bois, but you have to accept that 3rd version and BF are never coming back
>Sun/Moon
First taste
>USUM
For better story, but it's still stupid
>Sword

>Violet
Mainly because the Paradox versions and Ceruledge are better looking.

>>52628280
as far as i see it, pokemon are creatures and not characters. so when you see the latest mega anthropomorphised monstrosity they keep pumping out, i think people dislike them because they dont make sense in world.
looking at gen 8, at least rillaboom looks like something you might see a group of them living in the forest and actually being a part of an ecosystem. scorbunny or intelion on the other hand absolutley wouldn't.
so yeah unless its man made, or an alien, or some eldritch horror legendary i think well desgined pokemon should look like they fit into the world.
most jobmon and inanimate objects really dont do that. the gen 5 karate pokemon and klefki are just a few examples. and while ceruledge and amararouge look good they are literally people not pokemon.
at least garbodor makes sense for being like a pollution based pokemon, but the ice cream with a face cannot be called good design for a pokemon i'm sorry.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52629229
Basically this.

Two things that I (personally) think:
- Designs taking inspiration from very specific things is fine, but there's a certain threshold where turns from mere inspiration/homage to "pokemon but its X". In a lot of ways mons should be able to stand on their own without knowing what they're referencing if they do. A good example being Sableye being loosely based on Hopkinsville aliens, but standing on its own as just a weird gem goblin thing.
- I far prefered when Pokemon (for the most part) adhered to similar features and design principles: mons had the same eye shapes from a pool of common ones, they all featured (somewhat) realistic proportions, and for the most part they were conceptualized by the same person who embodied certain design principles when creating them. My issue with a lot of mons that people might like isn't that they aren't an individual good design in isolation; my issue is that when put next to earlier generations they don't look remotely similar. I prefer cohesive designs over individually strong but different ones.

But I'm an autist so whatever.

>>52629401
Life is bound by certain rules. Very few things in our world entirely break those rules and often do it in only exceptional circumstances. I'm talking of these anatomical facts that we see in how limbs work for animals, skeletons, etc. Obviously Pokemon is fantasy and can do what they want, but the vast majority of its initial designs created a world where Pokemon acted in the same way; they all adhered to certain facts of how different body parts look and work. Newer designs seem to be moving away from that in a lot of ways with more noodle-y arms, generally (inb4 nitpicked examples) less "realistic" muscular", and eyes that break established eye trends.

I get the whole "life is diverse and it finds a way" but I don't think most of the designs that went away from established patterns needed to in order to gets its concept across. And if it did need to break the pattern to convey something specific, those tend to be the acceptable exceptions.

But again, this all my own 'tism. I just don't really like the idea of going through a game that feels like everyone's epic OC is walking around instead of a world filled with realistic (for its own world) animals for to interact with.

Spicy post but I do think there’s a lot of truth to this though on the other hand Gamefreak has always blurred the lines. You look back on Dragon Quest as the originator for these kinds of things and you start to see where the paradoxical nature comes from. DQ has a lot of hyper specific monsters that don’t entirely make sense as a species but you’re expected to take at face value and roll with it because it’s just part of the world and they’re monsters. Pokémon isn’t that far removed from DQ design philosophy in many ways but they’ve always wanted to have their cake and eat it too and suggest a more cohabitating world of people and Pokémon. It’s in the opening. And when you try to create that natural living world image in players heads it becomes harder and harder to reconcile the little bits of Pokémon that are more like those specific bizarro Dragon Quest monsters. Yeah Pidgeys just being birds that do bird shit and reproduce to make more pidgeys has an internal consistency I can get behind. All Jynx’s looking like…that become harder to rationalize. Kangaskhan all being mothers with babies from birth completely shatters everything. And they’ve never really even attempted to reconcile any of this. Are all Froslass the spirits of dead women? Etc etc. But I do 100% agree with your overall point that there is not one THING that makes a Pokémon a Pokémon. They’ve always had the potential to be anything any people just have personal preferences they tend to ascribe to what the core philosophy SHOULD be.

>>52634832
I mean to a point yes. We as a society fundamentally misunderstand criticism at every turn. To the point that many people think it’s possible and get mad when criticism is shown to LACK objectivity.
Video game journalism is the perfect example. Criticism can only really serve as a relative marker to your understanding of your own preferences. Various mediums will try to narrow down a checklist of things a work should attempt to hit but all art movements have also been defined by pieces that buck those mainstream standards. With something as nebulous as ‘Pocket Monsters,’ we simply don’t have any kind of objective markers to work off of. Largely because Pokémon has always been anything and it’s very difficult to find a throughline even among the initial 151. Let alone through now 1000+ designs.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
ITT: A bunch of smart anons who are trying to establish a set of rules that consistute the stronger designs (ones with near universal popularity or very few people disliking them) and a bunch of dense anons trying to cope for their favorites that don't meet the former criteria by vaguely dismissing the former anons.

Here's an amazing tip for Pokemon fans: you can like something that's shit. In fact, that's the secondary definition of being a Pokemon fan. You don't have to cope for something that's purely your own taste. You can accept something you like isn't universally great, but personally great. You can accept that from a perspective divorced from you or the individual there may be a greater perspective than the vast majority share that you can learn to understand.

Because no, there are no objective criteria for good Pokemon designs. Evaluating a design is purely subjective. Think overly complicated designs are bad? Too bad, I love overly complicated designs! Think overly simple designs are bad? Too bad, I love overly simple designs. Think anatomically correct designs are great? Too bad, I like wacky, stylized proportions.

The best we can to get an "objective" understanding is take a look at TPC data on popular Pokemon and try to draw conclusions from that, but even that would be entirely pointless without understanding the underlying reasons why a person likes a certain mon.

tl;dr: Stop being niggers who cop out of evaluating art because it's subjective

AKA you can start playing the game almost immediately (within 10-15 minutes) even if you haven't gone to the tutorial objective yet. Meanwhile, SM/USUM ties you down to its railroad tracks for 40+ minutes before moving you to another set of railroad tracks for the rest of the story.

>>52627997
If the raid pokemon uses a move against your ally that effects you in some way or could effect you in the future, it will display it using that move for you as well, appearing as though it's taken two moves when it should have taken one. This includes buffs, weather, terrain, moves that inflict status, I think some of their special raid actions, and probably a few other things. I'm not sure if this is the case when they bring up their shields, that might be a genuinely free action they get to take, but most of the time it's a move they used against another player or NPC.

>>52633180
Electric is a dogshit type for any physical attacker without a signature move, so make Iron Thorns special. Also differentiates it from Ttar.
Without Sandstorm, it really doesn't benefit from Rock-typing, there aren't many special Rock moves, and it's not even made of rock anymore, so make it Electric/Dark.
Its speed as-is is stuck in a terrible middle-ground, where it's too fast to be good in Trick Room, but too slow to really be fast. So make it faster. Differentiates it from Ttar even more.
So make it fast. The game says it's smarter and doesn't pick fights as often, so it also makes sense for it to be a faster special attacker instead of a bulky physical attacker. Plus, Dark is a "crafty" type.

Also, give it Nasty Plot (because it's smart) and Dark Pulse (because it should at least have access to both STABs).

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52587470
Only rich mulch boosts your yield. If you meant using boost mulch to get berries faster, then rich mulch is still better for that purpose since it doubles your yield (as opposed to boost mulch making your crops grow 1.5 faster), you only have to use it once per berry (while in most cases a berry will need multiple uses of boost mulch), and only costs double the price of boost mulch.

Ideally you want to use both if possible, as long as you can cover the cost in FP.

You need to find a way to balance aquisition and utility. I think one thing that makes the paradoxes so much stranger is that their original descriptions mentioned in the Pokedex aren't a perfect match to the real ones we get.
Dex entries from the paradoxes' respective games:
>This Pokémon shares many similarities with Iron Hands, an object mentioned in a certain expedition journal.
>Some of its notable features match those of an object named within a certain expedition journal as Iron Thorns.
>This Pokémon has characteristics similar to those of Flutter Mane, a creature mentioned in a certain book.
>This mysterious Pokémon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.
In iron moth and sandy shocks' cases, it says the connection is a lot closer but still doesn't want to outright verify it.
>Data is lacking, but the Pokémon’s traits match up with a creature shown in an expedition journal. (Entry directly copy pasted between versions)
Roaring Moon and Iron Valiant also have entries that still doubt their direct connection.
>It is possible that this is the creature listed as Roaring Moon in an expedition journal that still holds many mysteries.
>It's possible that this is the object listed as Iron Valiant in a certain expedition journal.
Like at any point, the dex entries from their host games aren't even sure if they're exactly what was described. The only ones that seem to be more direct are the box legends, but even these entries seem suspiciously worded.
>This seems to be the Winged King mentioned in an old expedition journal.
>This seems to be the Iron Serpent mentioned in an old book.
It just seems very strange to me that if these were the same Pokemon Heath saw, why they weren't closer of a match, especially ones like Slither Wing that only seem somewhat close.
To throw in the same book a creature explicitly stated to be made up just feels strange too. Something's up on their origins that may or may not ever be acknowledged in DLC.

The motive is still a bit questionable, though I do think it's plausible that he was worried about another explorer stealing his thunder if they were able to return there and solve the strange dream and the crystals where he couldn't.
Claiming there's dangerous pokemon that killed one of your team makes it less likely other people are willing to go, and could make you seem as a shoe-in for further expeditions when you're the only one who has seen them in person.

And then on the next expedition, if the team didn't find any, Heath could just point out the fact that he said they were pretty rare and elusive.It's just the case where if Heath's story was too outlandish, he wouldn't get the support or funding to stage another expedition.
The fact that nobody even bothered with an expedition for 60 years would point to his plan backfiring and making people doubt there was anything of value at all in the crater. But to add onto that, the fact that Heath didn't attempt to stage a smaller expedition to get better evidence would also call his motives into question. If he truly saw Paradox pokemon, then there would be more he could do than get a single blurry photograph if he came back prepared.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52616407
Being immune to status and shit like Leech Seed/Defog/Taunt/etc means it can pivot in on passive mons that rely on those moves to make progress.

Meanwhile Ghost/Steel is a good defensive typign that lets it pivot in on common moves like Rapid Spin/Close Combat/etc. If you run Balloon this also makes it good for pivoting into stuff like Great Tusk (be careful of Knock), Clodsire, Ting Lu, etc

But Ghost/Steel is also a great offensive type, especially when paired with Nasty Plot (which means you can use Make it Rain twice and be neutral at worst), and Focus Blast (which hits stuff like Chi Yu). This is also complemented by a speed tier that, while not super fast, is fast enough to outspeed defensive mons and even stuff like Adamant Great Tusk. It also means that it can effectively run Scarf and outspeed your Dragonites (which can't touch it with E-speed), non-scarf Chi Yus, Cyclizars, and Dragapults

In terms of the "high spdef mons and Steel resists" part, all of them get melted by Shadow Ball/Focus Blast, and the few that don't fall prey to Scarf Trick sets, which have become increasingly common

In general, what makes it so good is that it has just about everything it needs to succeed, can run a billion sets, and you're never truly safe against it, because it can just whip out something like Scarf or Balloon or even T-wave and mess you up. It's not broken, but it's very, very strong

Meow is a decent pivot/Knock spammer/Donzo answer but it's just got a lot going against it right now. B rank doesn't mean "bad", it just means that it's decent, has a niche, but isn't fantastic.

Generally I'd describe the rankings as this

>S-rank
Top of the metagame. These are basically on every team and play a huge part in influencing the metagame, often shaping it around them
>A-rank
Really good. Not quite as good as S-rank but are good at what they do and generally find themselves on most teams.
>B-rank
Decent. These Pokemon are just kind of "okay" in general. They have their niches, and they will find their way onto some teams (usually specific relevant archetypes like Screens/Stack/Rain/etc) and perform decently there. Their niches are ones that some teams will need, but not many. This is where you start running into "off-meta" or "counterpick" options
>C-Rank
Niche. These Pokemon, for some reason or another, are niche. They're not bad, but they're usually either restricted to very specific, off-meta archetypes (Sun/Trick Room/Stall), or can perform a more general niche (such as sweeper or revenge killer or wall), but are outclassed in most instances by other, more popular Pokemon. This is where most of the "counterpick" options lie
>D-rank
Bad/Hyper-niche. Just about everything here is pretty bad. Not bad enough to be unranked, but bad enough to nto be worth using outside of very specific team archetypes/builds.

>>52618086
On paper, Shift Gear can work.

Like I said, its' best Steel STAB forfeits the speed boost you'd get from Shift Gear, so you're essentially forced into using Iron Head, which while satisfactory, isn't the kind of high power STAB you want for a cleaner. Gunk Shot is fine enough as a secondary STAB, accuracy issues aside, and I think despite my earlier comments, it's mandatory on a set like this for the raw power.

The problems start once you realize that it has fuck all for coverage. Your best physical coverage moves are Bulldoze, Zen Headbutt, and Tera Blast. Zen doesn't hit much outside of Pex and Amoong, Bulldoze basically hits nothing but other Revavrooms, and Tera Blast, while fine as emergency coverage, forces you to give up your unique typing and thus makes you infinitely more vulnerable to priority.

Things are only compounded when you realize that setting up in this meta is a nightmare between all the insanely strong moves being fired off and the sheer amount of hazards getting thrown out. You could run Boots or Black Sludge to mitigate the hazards somewhat, but +1 moves off of 110 attack, while strong, isn't THAT strong, so in theory you'd want something like Orb.

Essentially it boils down to it not having enough coverage, not having chances to setup, and not having the raw power to crush stuff.

>>52623974
This. Moves that affect the field affect all players, like Stadium cards in tcg. Think of it like this, if it can be redircrected it can also be blocked. Surf can still proct to Storm Drain but cannot be prevented from hitting everyone. Helping Hand only circumvents this because it's priority is much higher than redictections at +6, it would act like Decorate and swap targets to the aggro if it were +2 or lower. Coaching is a rare exception to this as it cannot select a target, it always goes for the partner.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52624380
Sorry to double post but just to clarify, Helping Hand is also an anomaly because it does not let you target a target but still would be redirected, Coaching has a built in Stalwart to the partner.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52625542
Fire is big and I'd argue worth investing in damsge reduction against, but you have more ways to do that than your ability.
Last gen I ran a Guts Conkledur but gave it a life orb to throw people off into wasting time and burning me. It actually didnt work well at all, the opprotunity to burn was so low that it isnt nearly reliable. I even had a Mimikyu to burn myself if need be, but the Mimikyu would be too busy with TR or attacking that this rarley ever happened. Again, doubles demands you use your turns productivity, and setup strats like JustiBeat Whimsicott/Terrakion or Aqua Jet/Surf Coalossal only functioned because
>the sweeper after setup was no longer threatened to die as easily (usually by eliminating a threat off the field, but dynamax bulk also helps this)
>it reliably could sweep the whole field
That's a tall order to follow up with for a lot of setup pokemon, as they may have fantastic single target damage and could just die to the partner to whom they killed or would be threatened by a revenge killer. This is why setup gimmicks are by and large unsustainable as consistsnt strats and fail in the long run.

>>52634001
>there is no postgame
I really wanted to hunt shinies and train some pokemon once I beat the game but then quickly lost all desire.

There's about four things you can do post-game
Go pick up the five legendaries
Ace Tournament which is extremely repetitive
The handful of gym challenges
Raids which are extremely repetitive

I'm not joking when I say that's it. There's no minigames, hidden quests, and you cannot rebattle the E4, gym leaders or trainers. Nothing.

And as someone that hasn't played since gen 6, SV felt somewhere between gen 2 and gen 3 with how rough it was. It's all a huge step back, especially with how they just hand things out to you and put everything in the menus. The shittiest romhacks are more creative than SVs QoL solutions.

posts.com:
As someone who values replay value more than post-game (especially since I hate every battle facility outside of a few of the frontier ones and the PWT), I honestly really don't care that there's no Battle Tower. In fact, I welcome it because it means you don't need to grind that stupid boring mode for competitive items. I don't see the point in adding battle facilities if they don't bother to make them creative and actually worth doing when online battles already exist.

And in terms of replay value, SV has FAR more to offer than any other mainline Pokemon game, full stop. There's just so many fun ways you can experience the game and so much options for Pokemon, you can choose to do any of the badges in any order, and I love being able to catch foreshadowing or implications to the characters that I didn't notice before. Currently doing a replay where I'm traversing the map "naturally", treating it like a normal route by just challenging the gyms and Team Star and not facing any of the titans until I get to a point where I'd need a specific upgrade and it's been really comfy. Been using a completely different team to my old one too.

>>52615701
The blender script is still fairly new, so it can only import pokemon models as of right now. If you try to import trainer models, they come out as a faceless abominations.

That's because the trainers in SV use blend shapes (or morph targets) for facial animations, and the blender script doesn't know how to import those yet.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
However, the 3ds max script (the one that the blender script is based on) can import those blend shapes. So hopefully, the blender script may also import those sometime in the future.

(Ignore the missing eye textures. Those were in a separate folder, since a lot of trainers share the same eye textures and stuff. And honestly, I'm lazy and can't be arsed to set them up in 3ds Max, since I personally hate this software's interface.)
